Table content:
Device | PCI/USB ID | Working?
GPU |  | Yes
Ethernet |  | Yes
Wireless |  | Yes
Audio |  | Yes
Touchpad |  | Yes
Camera |  | Yes
Card Reader |  | Yes
Fingerprint Reader |  | No

The HP Envy 15t-j000 Quad Edition is a laptop released in 2013.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: This laptop has secure boot enabled by default. In order to install Arch this should be disabled. UEFI should be set to legacy mode.

sections.title: Battery and Power Management
sections.content:
The rated battery life for this laptop is 9hrs and with configuration 5.5 hrs is usually possible.

Install acpi, thermald, tlp, iw, smartmontools, intel-ucode and cpupower.

Start/enable thermald.service and cpupower.service

See TLP for details on its configuration and the page dedicated to the microcode for explanation on loading it.

sections.title: Trackpad
sections.content:
The trackpad for this laptop supports a virtual scroll wheel. To enable it, comment out the following:

```
/etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/10-evdev.conf
```

```
Section "InputClass"
       Identifier "evdev touchpad catchall"
       MatchIsTouchpad "on"
       MatchDevicePath "/dev/input/event*"
       Driver "evdev"
EndSection
```

sections.title: GPU
sections.content: If you have the version of this laptop with an NVIDIA card, see NVIDIA Optimus.

sections.title: Fingerprint Reader
sections.content: This laptop comes with a fingerprint reader but there is no Linux driver for it.

sections.title: mSATA SSD
sections.content: This laptop has a mSATA bay that can be used as a cache for a hard drive. See Bcache or LVM#Cache for details.
